quotes.t: It is about the {qword}camaraderie{/qword} of troops bound for Vietnam who, as their leader warns, have one another and nothing but one another when they fall into hell.
… men on the sunny side of middle age, physical, competitive, used to the quick {qword}camaraderie{/qword} of the team, be it a firefighting squad or a trading desk.

The best of adolescence was the intense male friendships—not only because of the cozy feelings of {qword}camaraderie{/qword} they afforded … but because of the opportunity they provided for uncensored talk.
Except for occasional bursts of {qword}camaraderie{/qword}, which came like thunderstorms, we were never close.
